alert.note: Alert for Estill (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:31AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Estill, north central Pulaski, Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 515 AM EST... At 430 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Bee Lick, or 13 miles east of Liberty, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bee Lick and Bandy around 440 AM EST. Indian Lakes Park, Gum Sulphur, Ottowa, Quail, Spiro, Bromo, Willailla and Wabp around 445 AM EST. Hiatt, Lake Linville, Renfro Valley, Maretburg and Wellhope around 450 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Vernon, Boone, Wildie, Roundstone, Hummel, Muellersville, Conway, Orlando, Snider, Dudley Station, Climax, Threelinks, Goochland, Bummer, Johnetta, Disputanta, Cooksburg, Morrill, Robinet, Donaro, Eglon, Clover Bottom, Kerby Knob, Loam, Shirley, Dango, Waneta, Sandgap, Collingsworth, Brazil, Hurley, Hisel, Alcorn, Shop Branch, Locust Branch, McKee, Foxtown, Lakes, Wind Cave, Macedonia, Turkey Foot, New Zion, Blanton Flats, Bradshaw and Gray Hawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
